Fun Category
"Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage - L. Tzu"
"Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead - O. Wilde"
"I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific - L. Tomlin"
"A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man - L. Turner"
"The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis - D. Alighieri"
"One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors - Plato"
"Life is wasted on the living - D. Adams"
"The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions - A. Adler"
"Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor - S. Aleichem"
"A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life - J. Allen"
"Seventy percent of success in life is showing up - W. Allen"
"Life loves the liver of it - M. Angelou"
"Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome - I. Asimov"
"Our life is what our thoughts make it - M. Aurelius"
"The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing - M. Aurelius"
"Here is the test to find whether your mission on Earth is finished: if you're alive, it isn't - R. Bach"
"The hope is a perfect breakfast but a bitter dinner - F. Bacon"
"Life is a long lesson in humility - J. M. Barrie"
"Time is like a snowflake, disappears while we are deciding what to do with it", "- R. Battaglia"
"Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay - S. d. Beauvoir"
"Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it - I. Berlin"
"Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well - J. Billings"
"Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs - C. Bronte"
"To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance - Buddha"
"Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment - Buddha"
"Most people have never learned that one of the main aims in life is to enjoy it - S. Butler"
"Life is not an exact science, it is an art - S. Butler"
"Don't go through life, grow through life - E. Butterworth"
"Remember never to confuse kindness and availability with weakness - C. Butturini"
"The purpose of life is a life of purpose - R. Byrne"
"We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us - J. Campbell"
"The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are - J. Campbell"
"I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive - J. Campbell"
"Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot - C. Chaplin"
"How can you be alive and happy if there in the world people who can't? - Che Guevara"
"Any idiot can face a crisis - it's day to day living that wears you out - A. Chekhov"
"The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground - G. K. Chesterton"
"While there's life, there's hope - M. T. Cicero"
"What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner - S. G. Colette"
"Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated - Confucius"
"There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles - S. Covey"
"Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less - M. Curie"
"A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life - C. Darwin"
"Often we are able of seeing an opportunity only after someone has picked it up - E. De Bono"
"To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else - E. Dickinson"
"What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds - W. Dyer"
"Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life - W. Dyer"
"Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile - A. Einstein"
"All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on - H. Ellis"
"All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better - R. W. Emerson"
"It is not length of life, but depth of life - R. W. Emerson"
"The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall - R. W. Emerson"
"With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now - R. W. Emerson"
"Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day - R. W. Emerson"
"The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed - Eminem"
"The greatest pleasure of life is love - Euripides"
"There is just one life for each of us: our own - Euripides"
"Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was - R. L. Evans"
"One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure - W. Feather"
"We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us - E. M. Forster"
"The main facts in human life are five: birth, food, sleep, love and death - E. M. Forster"
"In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on - R. Frost"
"A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone - R. Frost"
"Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever - M. Gandhi"
"My life is my message - M. Gandhi"
"Life is a series of collisions with the future; it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be - J. O. y. Gasset"
"Everything you can imagine doing, or can dream of, do it now. Audacity has genius and magic - J. W. Goethe"
"I love those who yearn for the impossible - J. W. v. Goethe"
"What is important in life is life, and not the result of life - J. W. v. Goethe"
"It's all about quality of life and finding a happy balance between work and friends and family - P. Green"
"You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way - W. Hagen"
"The only disability in life is a bad attitude - S. Hamilton"
"When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?' - S. J. Harris"
"The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much - W. Hazlitt"
"The story of life is quicker then the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye - J. Hendrix"
"The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters - A. Hepburn"
"Life is half spent before we know what it is - G. Herbert"
"We can't plan life. All we can do is be available for it - L. Hill"
"Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it - L. Holtz"
"I love life because what more is there? - A. Hopkins"
"Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even - Horace"
"Life is largely a matter of expectation - Horace"
"Fortunately analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself still remains a very effective therapist - K. Horney"
"You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need - V. Howard"
"Life in abundance comes only through great love - E. Hubbard"
"A healthful hunger for a great idea is the beauty and blessedness of life - J. Ingelow"
"Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact - W. James"
"The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes - W. James"
"The great use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it - W. James"
"To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly - W. James"
"This life is worth living, we can say, since it is what we make it - W. James"
"A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain - W. James"
"The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases - C. Jung"
"Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood - H. Keller"
"Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future - J. F. Kennedy"
"Once you say you're going to settle for second, that's what happens to you in life - J. F. Kennedy"
"Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments - R. Kennedy"
"Life is a succession of moments, to live each one is to succeed - C. Kent"
"Our life always expresses the result of our dominant thoughts - S. Kierkegaard"
"Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced - S. Kierkegaard"
"I do not regret one moment of my life - L. Langtry"
"Life is something to do when you can't get to sleep - F. Lebowitz"
"If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of - B. Lee"
"Life is too short to work so hard - V. Leigh"
"Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans - J. Lennon"
"The most busy life is the most happy - G. Leopardi"
"The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere - A. M. Lindbergh"
"I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches - A. R. Longworth"
"Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living? - B. Marley"
"For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance - M. McLaughlin"
"The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware - H. Miller"
"Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets - A. Miller"
"Who is able to listen not only is pleasing to everyone, but after a while he even ends up learning something - W. Mizner"
"The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life - W. Morris"
"I look back on my life like a good day's work, it was done and I am satisfied with it - G. Moses"
"Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be - G. Moses"
"To live is to change, and to be perfect is to have changed often - J. H. Newman"
"He who has a why to live can bear almost any how - F. Nietzsche"
"People living deeply have no fear of death - A. Nin"
"We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life - W. Osler"
"Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith - J. Osteen"
"Life must be lived as play - Plato"
"A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives - J. Robinson"
"We are all here for a spell, get all the good laughs you can - W. Rogers"
"If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor - E. Roosevelt"
"I have found that if you love life, life will love you back - A. Rubinstein"
"There is no wealth but life - J. Ruskin"
"The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge - B. Russell"
"A baby is God's opinion that life should go on - C. Sandburg"
"Nearly all the best things that came to me in life have been unexpected, unplanned by me - C. Sandburg"
"Everything has been figured out, except how to live - J. Sartre"
"I think I've discovered the secret of life, you just hang around until you get used to it - C. M. Schulz"
"Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier - A. Schweitzer"
"Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life - Seneca"
"While we are postponing, life speeds by - L. A. Seneca"
"Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters - L. A. Seneca"
"A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing - G. B. Shaw"
"Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh - G. B. Shaw"
"Kindness, I've discovered, is everything in life - I. B. Singer"
"Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it - S. Smiles"
"Beware the barrenness of a busy life - Socrates"
"Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued - Socrates"
"The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want - B. Stein"
"I take a simple view of life. It is keep your eyes open and get on with it - L. Sterne"
"An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding - R. L. Stevenson"
"There is only one difference between a long life and a good dinner: that, in the dinner, the sweets come last - R. L. Stevenson"
"Our business in life is not to succeed, but to continue to fail in good spirits - R. L. Stevenson"
"May you live all the days of your life - J. Swift"
"I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy - R. Tagore"
"We live in the world when we love it - R. Tagore"
"The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it - H. D. Thoreau"
"To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts - H. D. Thoreau"
"To think of knowing is like looking at the sea believing it ends at the horizon - L. Tiburzi"
"True life is lived when tiny changes occur - L. Tolstoy"
"Everything in life is luck - D. Trump"
"Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first - M. Twain"
"Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life - M. Twain"
"When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained - M. Twain"
"A well spent day brings happy sleep - L. da Vinci"
"Life well spent is long - L. da Vinci"
"Every man dies. Not every man really lives - W. Wallace"
"Life is never easy for those who dream - R. J. Waller"
"You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough - M. West"
"To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all - O. Wilde"
"A grapefruit is a lemon who had an opportunity and seized it - O. Wilde"
"Sometimes it is better to be silent and looks stupid rather then talking, taking off every doubt - O. Wilde"
"Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about - O. Wilde"
"Give me the luxuries of life and I will willingly do without the necessities - F. L. Wright"
"Unbeing dead isn't being alive - e. e. cummings"
"Our ideals are our better selves - A. B. Alcott"
"I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.' - M. Ali"
"Ad augusta per angusta - Anonymous"
"Let each man exercise the art he knows - Aristophanes"
"We are what we do daily, so excellence is not in a single act but in the behavior - Aristotle"
"Hope is a waking dream - Aristotle"
"Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can - A. Ashe"
"Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig - M. Aurelius"
"You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past - R. Bach"
"Monuments to intelligence survive to monuments to power - F. Bacon"
"Give light and people will find the way - E. Baker"
"Enthusiasm moves the world - A. Balfour"
"Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams - H. Ballou"
"It is always the simple that produces the marvelous - A. Barr"
"It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it - A. Barr"
"I do love to eavesdrop. It's inspirational, not only for subject matter but for actual dialogue, the way people talk - L. Barry"
"Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul - H. W. Beecher"
"If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door - M. Berle"
"The authentic self is the soul made visible - S. B. Breathnach"
"Happiness is the natural flower of duty - P. Brooks"
"Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship - Buddha"
"When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go - C. Burnett"
"Veni, vidi, vici - Caesar"
"Alea iacta est - Caesar"
"Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain - J. Campbell"
"Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls - J. Campbell"
"Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears - A. Camus"
"Who fights can lose, who doesn't already has - Che Guevara"
"Backward? Not even to take a run! - Che Guevara"
"Everything that deserves being done, deserves being done well - P. D. S. Chesterfield"
"Without education we incur in the risk of taking seriously all educated people - G. K. Chesterton"
"The courage is the first of human qualities, because it makes all the others possible - W. Churchill"
"A pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty - W. Churchill"
"Only one thing makes a dream impossible. the fear of failing - P. Coelho"
"Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell - B. Copeland"
"My tastes and inspirational artists were always rather eclectic and diverse - T. Dayne"
"I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination - J. Dean"
"Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul - Democritus"
"Think with your whole body - T. Deshimaru"
"Space is an inspirational concept that allows you to dream big - P. Diamandis"
"Teachers need to be more inspirational. But it's also up to engineering to make itself more interesting - B. Dickinson"
"You have to make it happen - D. Diderot"
"I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best - B. Disraeli"
"If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves - T. A. Edison"
"Imagination is more important than knowledge - A. Einstein"
"It is never too late to be what you might have been - G. Eliot"
"God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him - J. Elliot"
"Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself - D. Erasmus"
"It is easy to be courageous at safety distance - Esopo"
"To meet each other is a beginning, to remain together is a progress, to work together is a success - H. Ford"
"It is by acts and not by ideas that people live - A. France"
"Whoever is happy will make others happy too - A. Frank"
"How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world - A. Frank"
"A place for everything, everything in its place - B. Franklin"
"The best way out is always through - R. Frost"
"If it were not for hopes, the heart would break - T. Fuller"
"In a gentle way, you can shake the world - M. Gandhi"
"Be faithful to that which exists within yourself - A. Gide"
"It is not strong the one who never falls, but the one who falling manage to rise again - J. W. Goethe"
"Happy and great is only the one who, to be someone, needs neither to dictate nor to obey - J. W. Goethe"
"Love and desire are the spirit's wings to great deeds - J. W. v. Goethe"
"I arise full of eagerness and energy, knowing well what achievement lies ahead of me - Z. Grey"
"Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel - A. Hare"
"We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too - H. Hayes"
"Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge - A. J. Heschel"
"Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements - N. Hill"
"Belief creates the actual fact - W. James"
"The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money - T. Jefferson"
"Who aims at being great, be the servant of everyone - Jesus"
"Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future - S. Jobs"
"A very few things are impossible if you are diligent and capable. Big things are done not with strength but with perseverance - S. Johnson"
"If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome - M. Jordan"
"The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched, they must be felt with the heart - H. Keller"
"I am very conscious of who I am as an artist and as an inspirational person - R. Kelly"
"Many people see how things are and say: why? I see how things could be and say: why not? - R. Kennedy"
"Ideas shape the course of history - J. M. Keynes"
"I view art as an inspirational tool - T. Kincade"
"I do not fear the violents' words, rather the honests' silence - M. L. King"
"It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder - J. W. Krutch"
"If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it - L. Larcom"
"A limited brain contains and unlimited quantity of stupid things - S. Lec"
"You change your life by changing your heart - M. Lucado"
"Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree - M. Luther"
"Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul - T. Merton"
"A pencil and a dream can take you anywhere - J. Meyer"
"As knowledge increases, wonder deepens - C. Morgan"
"Act like you expect to get into the end zone - C. Morley"
"That which does not kill us makes us stronger - F. Nietzsche"
"It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light - A. Onassis"
"We have it in our power to begin the world over again - T. Paine"
"Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed - B. Pascal"
"Change your thoughts and you change your world - N. V. Peale"
"Sport is something that is very inspirational for young people - Pele"
"Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself - Plato"
"What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality - Plutarch"
"I have looked into your eyes with my eyes. I have put my heart near your heart - Pope John XXIII"
"Hope is but the dream of those who wake - M. Prior"
"When deeds speak, words are nothing - P. Proudhon"
"My mind's my kingdom - F. Quarles"
"Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start - N. Qubein"
"We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone - R. Reagan"
"It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped - T. Robbins"
"We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish - T. Robbins"
"Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment - T. Robbins"
"Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present - J. Rohn"
"The future is in the hands of the people who believe in their dreams - E. Roosevelt"
"Believe you can and you're halfway there - T. Roosevelt"
"You must do the things you think you cannot do - E. Roosevelt"
"With self-discipline anything is possible - T. Roosevelt"
"When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome - W. Rudolph"
"Don't let the fear of striking out hold you back - B. Ruth"
"A sunray can delete millions of shadows - S. Francesco"
"Mankind is made great or little by its own will - F. Schiller"
"What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail? - R. H. Schuller"
"I am so fresh in soul and spirit that life gushes and bubbles around me in a thousand springs - R. Schumann"
"Books are challenging and inspirational to me - A. Sedaris"
"Per aspera ad astra - Seneca"
"Don't wait for the right moment, make it! - G. B. Shaw"
"If you don't have a big heart you'll not succeed - L. K. Shing"
"I have amazing friends who have led inspirational lives - A. Shue"
"Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success - S. Sivananda"
"It's inspirational to see someone who is dying smile - A. Specter"
"Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant - R. L. Stevenson"
"There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness - H. Suyin"
"Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky - R. Tagore"
"Want to be happy for a moment? Avenge. Want to be happy forever? Forgive - Tertulliano"
"I have never allowed school to interfere with my education - M. Twain"
"You have to believe in yourself - S. Tzu"
"Create each day anew - M. Ueshiba"
"Half of the beauty depends on the landscape, the other half on the man who looks at it - L. Ultang"
"I wanted to do something inspirational for my children - H. Weinstein"
"Sad is that disciple who does not advance his master - L. da Vinci"
"There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it - E. Wharton"
"Better to be called something positive and inspirational than something negative - D. Yen"
"God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man - A. Young"
"Deacon Jones has been the most inspirational person in my football career - J. Youngblood"
